citation.article-title: Flavobacterium sasangense sp. nov., isolated from a wastewater stream polluted with heavy metals
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium sasangense sp. nov.
Flavobacterium sasangense (sa.san.gen′se. N.L. neut. adj. sasangense pertaining to the Sasang stream, from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods, 0.3–0.5 μm wide and 1.4–1.9 μm long.
Colonies on R2A agar are yellowish orange and circular with entire margins.
Growth occurs at 10–35 °C (optimum, 30 °C) and at pH 6.0–9.5 (optimum, pH 7.5–8.0).
Range of NaCl for growth is 0–1.0 % (w/v); optimum growth occurs without NaCl.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Gliding motility is observed.
Grows on R2A agar, LB agar, nutrient agar (Difco) and tryptic soy agar (Difco) at 30 °C, but not on MacConkey agar (Difco).
Facultative anaerobe.
Casein, gelatin, starch and tyrosine are hydrolysed.
Tweens 80 and 20, aesculin, CM-cellulose and urea are not hydrolysed.
Congo red is not absorbed by colonies and flexirubin-type pigments are not produced.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite or nitrogen.
Indole, H2S and acetoin are not produced and citrate is not utilized.
Produces acid from lactose, l-arabinose, melibiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-mannose, d-mannitol and d-glucose.

Alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase and valine arylamidase activities are present, while esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), cystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase activities are weak; lipase (C14), α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.

Resistant to polymyxin B, gentamicin, kanamycin, lincomycin and oleandomycin, but susceptible to ampicillin, streptomycin, penicillin G, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, neomycin, carbenicillin and novobiocin.
MK-6 is the major respiratory lipoquinone.
The cellular membrane contains iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, iso-C15 : 1 G, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, iso-C16 : 0 3-OH, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH as the major fatty acids (>5 %; minor components are listed above).
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 32.5 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain is YC6274T (=KCTC 22246T =DSM 21067T), isolated from Sasang stream in Busan, Korea.
